revised_title: The Biochemistry of Copper Deficiency: Synthetic Processes and Impacts on Phospholipid Synthesis
tldr: The authors investigate the biochemistry of copper deficiency and its effects on various synthetic processes in rats. They find that phospholipid synthesis is significantly depressed in copper-deficient rats due to a failure in the process of condensation of acyl CoA with α-glycerophosphate to form phosphatidic acids. This study aims to understand the metabolic disturbances that lead to demyelination of the central nervous system in disease.
